title: What is the significance of the ancient concept of "pontifex" and how does it relate to the cyclical nature of history and legends of the world's center?
first_phrase: This text explores the ancient etymology of the term "pontifex" and its connection to bridging two worlds. It also delves into obscure historical references and geographic transpositions related to ancient traditions, including the concept of the "island at the end of the world" and the land of the sun - Thule. The text discusses the "seed" of the Aryan-Iranian race in Airyanem-Vaej6, and its connection to the image of the King of Kings and the Representative of the God of Light. The author mentions the cycles of history, from the golden age to the dark age, and their relation to usurpation and rebellion. Finally, the author highlights the doctrine of the supreme center and the ages of the world, its connection to cycles and periodic manifestations. This text ends with a reference to the legend of the Grail.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the doctrine of the supreme center and the ages of the world teaches us about the cyclical nature of existence and the periodic manifestations of a single principle. Without understanding these concepts, many traditional myths and legends would remain incomprehensible fragments. Remembering this knowledge can give us hope and guide us through times of decline, reminding us that renewal is always possible.
